heisigStory: Prior to the use of metal, trees were once cut down and bound together for use as scaffolding material. In the case of this kanji, what is being constructed is not a skyscraper but a simple float.
koohiiStory1: Japanese festival floats are often so tall they need wood scaffolds to be completed. (http://www.japan-guide.com/e/e5909.html).
koohiiStory2: You need a SCAFFOLD made of WOOD to build a FLOAT if it will be several stories high.
myStory: khung. giàn giáo. 2 mấy cây giáo bằng gỗ dựng quanh cái cây làm giàn giáo
words: 桟橋(さんきょう): wharf, bridge, jetty, pier
